definition: same as 陽關大道|阳关大道[Yang2 guan1 Da4 dao4]
positive (electric.)/sun/male principle (Taoism)/Yang, opposite: 陰|阴[yin1]
mountain pass/to close/to shut/to turn off/to concern/to involve
surname Guan

road/path/CL:條|条[tiao2],股[gu3]/principle/truth/morality/reason/skill/method/Dao (of Daoism)/to say/to speak/to talk/classifier for long thin things (rivers, cracks etc), barriers (walls, doors etc), questions (in an exam etc), commands, courses in a meal, steps in a process/(old) circuit (administrative division)
lit. you hit the high road, I'll cross the log bridge (idiom)/fig. you go your way, I'll go mine/you do it your way, I'll do it mine
pinyin: ni3 zou3 ni3 de5 Yang2 guan1 Dao4 , wo3 guo4 wo3 de5 du2 mu4 qiao2
containing_words.word: 你走你的阳关道，我过我的独木桥

sentences.english: You go to your Yangguan Dao, I have had my Naihe Qiao.
sentences.chinese: 你走你的阳关道，我过我的奈何桥。

definition: single-log bridge/(fig.) difficult path
everyone minds their own business
pinyin: jing3 shui3 bu4 fan4 he2 shui3

definition: (lit.) the road through Yangguan 陽關|阳关[Yang2 guan1]/(fig.) wide open road/bright future
see 兩不相欠|两不相欠[liang3 bu4 xiang1 qian4]
lit. river water does not interfere with well water (idiom); Do not interfere with one another./Mind your own business.
pinyin: he2 shui3 bu4 fan4 jing3 shui3

definition: to be even/to be quits/to be even-steven
lit. persons who walk different paths cannot make plans together/to go separate ways (idiom)
pinyin: dao4 bu4 tong2 bu4 xiang1 wei2 mou2

definition: (of marriage or business partners) to break up (idiom)/to separate
to split up/to break all ties
to rip one's robe as a sign of repudiating a sworn brotherhood (idiom)/to break all friendly ties
loan settled (business term)/business complete to the satisfaction of both parties
the road back to where one came from
to write off at one stroke
to do one's best/to shape up/to behave/to fend for oneself/you're on your own
from here on
(neologism c. 2012) (interjection of encouragement) Let’s do this!/Come on, you can do this!
